features: Well-Absorbed Iron: Provides 36 mg of elemental iron per capsule in a well-absorbed, non-constipating form as iron bisgycinate, with B vitamins and vitamin C to enhance iron’s absorption*
Nourish Your Blood: An optimal blood support supplement that combines vitamin C, vitamin B6 (pyridoxal 5'-phosphate), vitamin B12 (methylcobalamin), and folate (L-5-MTHF) with iron bisglycinate*

Increase Iron Levels: An iron deficiency can manifest as weakness, fatigue, shortness of breath on exertion, dizziness, tinnitus, spots before the eyes, drowsiness, irritability, infrequent menses, and loss of libido
Plus cofactors: Iron is not the only nutrient essential for healthy red blood cells. Being deficient in key B vitamins can also lead to adverse issues with red blood cell formation*

Trusted: Thorne is trusted by 100+ pro teams. Thorne is the only supplement manufacturer to collaborate with Mayo Clinic on wellness research and content. Thorne is a proud partner of U.S. Olympic Teams

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Thorne's Ferrasorb provides 36 mg of elemental iron per capsule, plus the active forms of folate and vitamins B6 and B12, which are essential for blood-building.* Vitamin C optimizes iron absorption.*

Unique Formula Ferrasorb contains well-absorbed iron bisglycinate and the active, tissue-ready, blood-building B vitamins -- B6, B12, and folate. Well-Researched Benefits Clinical research shows iron bisglycinate to be more effective at lower doses and with fewer side effects than conventional iron supplements like ferrous sulfate.* Purest Ingredients There are no unnecessary fillers or additives in Thorne supplements. Thorne is committed to providing high-quality supplements that contain research-backed ingredients, in efficacious amounts, that retain the potency to meet label claims until the day of expiration. Trusted Manufacturer For more than 30 years, Thorne has been trusted by health-care practitioners who prescribe our products to their patients. In addition, our products are now recommended by U.S. National Teams and multiple professional sports teams for their elite athletes. Thorne products are a testament to Thorne's mission to provide high-quality supplements that are tested for quality, safety, and efficacy.

Individuals at high risk for mineral deficiencies include the elderly because of deteriorating digestion, children and teenagers because of poor diet, individuals who have an eating disorder, and anyone suffering from a chronic disease. Taking certain prescription medications can also cause mineral deficiencies. Because the mineral content of fruits and vegetables depends on the soil health a crop it is grown in, even a healthy individual who maintains a good diet can be at risk for a mineral deficiency because of mineral-depleted soils. By their very nature, minerals are not particularly well-absorbed by the human body. In addition, various dietary, lifestyle, and health factors can have a negative impact on mineral absorption. One of the barriers to mineral absorption is overcoming the natural form the mineral comes in. Thorne’s mineral ingredients are primarily in their chelated form – the mineral is linked to an amino acid or an organic acid via a molecular reaction that provides a predictable, high quality, and hypoallergenic chelate. Thorne’s mineral supplements are designed for optimal absorption.

When the highest standards have been met, Thorne creates higher ones. Sourcing Exceptional Ingredients We develop better standards for higher quality ingredients. Thorne cares deeply about where our ingredients come from. We partner only with suppliers whose practices emphasize quality, science, and responsibility. Better ingredients means better potency, absorption, and digestibility - and ultimately better health. Manufacturing the Right Way We manufacture our own products to ensure full supply chain transparency. For more than 30 years, we have invested in clean manufacturing practices. We refuse to use ingredients that can inhibit absorption. We perform our final production in the United States. Our Charleston, SC facility is third-party certified. Four Rounds of Testing We perform four rounds of testing for each product we manufacture – far above the industry standard. Thorne has invested in two state-of-the-art in-house laboratories that enable us to conduct four rounds of testing, including raw material testing, in-process batch testing, finished product testing, and expiration date stability testing for each lot of product that we manufacture. Thinking Sustainably We're thinking sustainably to protect our environment. We believe the environment should never be compromised for the sake of business gain. At Thorne, we believe that doing our part to protect the environment and its most valuable resources goes hand in hand with our product quality standards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good quality
reviews.reviewText: Very good product from a very good brand. The little supplement is packed with tons of vitamins that go great with iron. Awesome product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy on the Tummy
reviews.reviewText: I have tried almost EVERY iron supplement available and this brand is the only one that doesn't bother my stomach! Glad I kept trying and I love that it has all the additional supplements one will need when taking an iron supplement all in one small capsule.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The only iron supplement that I can tolerate.
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this brand. I have had chronically low iron most of my adult life. I have had it corrected by IV iron infusion and have tried many iron supplements. I wouldalways stop taking the iron supplement due to side effects and then my iron levels would plummet. When I went for my checkup 6 mos ago, my iron and ferritin were very low. My checkup today showed that all of my numbers have completely recovered with the daily use of Ferrasorb. This iron supplement is so much gentler on the stomach than any other I have taken. I can’t believe that it has worked so well, with no side effects!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are small pills, easy to swallow. I haven't had any discomfort in taking them. I feel the difference and will get my blood tested next month to confirm the efficacy.I wish Thorne would either make a smaller size bottle or put more pills in this bottle - or offer refills in a bag!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Stuff works great but use caution when taking on a regular basis! Took it for over a month because of low ferritin. Had my b12 level checked and it was sky high. Lab came back >2,000!! This stuff has way too much b12 for someone that is not deficient!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great brand and price
reviews.reviewText: This is the type of iron replacement that my naturopath recommended. This is also brand that she recommends often for various supplements. The price is excellent and I do buy this brand from Amazon all the time. It is a great manufacturer for supplements and this is the right way according to my doctor to supplement to improve your iron. I buy this item regularly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Iron Supplement
reviews.reviewText: Found this iron supplement easy to take and works!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: While pregnant, my midwives checked my iron levels and noticed they were a little on the low end. That definitely explained the extra fatigue I was having! They recommended this specific supplement and I started taking it immediately. I noticed an improvement in my fatigue within the first week of consistently taking it. I take it around the same time that I eat and haven't had an issues with it.
